alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Greensville; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:04PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT GREENSVILLE...SOUTHWESTERN SUSSEX AND EAST CENTRAL BRUNSWICK COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF EMPORIA THROUGH 145 PM EDT... At 103 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Purdy, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Purdy around 110 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Brink, Callaville, Bufford Crossroads, Lanes Corner, Pleasant Shade, Fields Crossroads, Durand, Slates Corner, Emporia Reservoir, and Slagles Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
